question: This system of Medicine literally means “Science of Life”. The Charak Samhita and Sushruta Samhita developed around 2500 BC are the main treaties of this system fully available today. According to this system, health is considered as a pre-requisite for achieving the goals of life i.e., Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha. It is based on the theory of Panchmahabhutas. This system of medicine is known as _?
explanation: Ayurveda is a system of Medicine that literally means “Science of Life”. The Charak Samhita and Sushruta Samhita developed around 2500 BC are the main treaties of this system fully available today. According to this system, health is considered as a pre-requisite for achieving the goals of life i.e., Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha. It is based on the theory of Panchmahabhutas. This system considers the human being as a microcosm which is a replica of the macrocosm (universe). The preventive aspect of Ayurveda is called Svastha-Vritta and it includes personal hygiene, regular daily routine, appropriate social behaviour and use of Rasayana.
